article:
Regarding 'cell damage', if ATP production is insufficient to maintain
function, "lethal function" is marked by disintegration of other organelles,
and autolysis proceeds.

A virus could cause damage to a cell microscopically, and these reversible
changes caused by swelling of the organelles are reflected in cellular swelling,
paleness of cytoplasm and development of small intracellular vacuoles, giving
rise to the widely used descriptive terms "cloudy swelling" and hydropic
degeneration.
